COMMENT_TX: Jim Kaat came to bat with the bases loaded and hit into a 6-4 force play at second.  But, nobody else advanced!  Both scoresheets agree that Bob Allison and Earl Battey (the runners on second and third) scored on the next batter's single to center.  So, neither one of them advanced on Kaat's grounder.  Strange! DWS: check if possible
$Jimmie Hall fouled a pitch off his right ankle before striking out and had to leave the game.
Carmel & Howard just missed HRs to RF in 9th inning.
Lights on at start of game
Timing of position switch a guess
Pepitone attempted steal - throw went into CF
Ball deflected by third baseman into left field
ball deflected by third baseman into left field
$Robinson out at second on appeal by Kubek who noted that Robinson failed to touch 2nd; Blefary loses hit
no explanation given for Kindall's departure
The Minnesota scorer says Oliva singled to left and the NY scorer says he walked!  Their totals for Twins hits in the game are different, too!
Hit into the sound system in centerfield
Ruled a CS for some weird reason
Xray knuckle, little finger, right hand

Both scorers agree that Ford grounded out (the NY scorer indicates the bunt) and neither scorer advances Boyer to second.  In fact, the next batter hits into a 5-4-3 DP with Boyer being putout at second base!
Whitey Ford threw just 59 pitches to the 26 batters he faced in 7 innings!
The bunt was hit between third and the pitcher; it's not clear which one fielded the ball.
Earl Battey was injured on the play at the plate
ej,keanj801,M,hallb901,Fair/foul call $Yankee Johnny Keane ejected by HP umpire Haller during during Oliva's at-bat when it was ruled that a little tapper he hit was off his body and therefore foul
The Twins only had two fielding assists in the entire game: a K23 on the leadoff hitter and a 5-3 in the 9th. The remaining 25 outs were unassisted putouts or K's!
$Congiliaro thought there were 3 outs and pulled up short of third base where he was tagged
Yankees elimanated from Pennant race today.
Two errors on play... one on bobble and one on throw
